item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 25, 2024 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. BBC Sound Effects Library (9 points | 1 comment)
2. NASA spacecraft to probe possibility of life in Europa's salty ocean (153 points | 112 comments)
3. Global EV Charging Points with Open Charge Map (24 points | 8 comments)
4. Hetzner introduces GPU server for AI training (36 points | 18 comments)
5. Social Web Foundation launches, supported by Vivaldi (39 points | 33 comments)
6. FRED: New Zealand open-access and crowdsource database of fossil records (56 points | 5 comments)
7. Hack GPON – how to access, change and edit fibre ONTs (157 points | 79 comments)
8. Insights after 11 years with Datomic [video] (121 points | 33 comments)
9. Who Is Marcellus Williams: Execution in Missouri Despite Evidence of Innocence (45 points | 7 comments)
10. On Impactful AI Research (199 points | 38 comments)
11. Furnace – the biggest multi-system chiptune tracker ever made (126 points | 39 comments)
12. Rearchitecting: Redis to SQLite (16 points | 5 comments)
13. Show HN: Hosting my website using my C web server (214 points | 78 comments)
14. OpenAI rolls out Advanced Voice Mode with more voices and a new look (49 points | 39 comments)
15. Lish Shell (5 points | discuss)
16. Beyond the route: Introducing granular MTA bus speed data (188 points | 53 comments)
17. Graph Coloring Methods (12 points | 1 comment)
18. Nova by Panic: The native Mac code editor that's fast and amazing (9 points | 9 comments)
19. Avoidance Mapping: What It Is and Where It Fits in the Cartography Cube (10 points | 2 comments)
20. Gmail's blue checkmarks are coming to iOS and Android (7 points | discuss)
21. Launch HN: Modern Realty (YC S24) – AI Real Estate Agent for Home Buyers (134 points | 271 comments)
22. Machine learning reveals factors for successful crowdfunding (17 points | 1 comment)
23. How I Built My Blog (41 points | 20 comments)
24. Doom on a modified rotary phone (84 points | 29 comments)
25. Filtered for home robots, fast and slow (33 points | 14 comments)
26. The Calculator that spawned the Microprocessor (2009) (98 points | 27 comments)
27. Why Most Published Research Findings Are False (2005) (185 points | 205 comments)
28. Ask HN: Platform for 11 year old to create video games? (109 points | 121 comments)
29. Working Turing Machine (119 points | 5 comments)
30. Show HN: Velvet – Store OpenAI requests in your own DB (81 points | 39 comments)
